item.title: Automatic Cache Updater/Downloader - Thoroughly Explained - Using CRCs
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Learn to use the constant fields in the HttpURLConnection class.

byte[] buf = new byte[1024]; ZipInputStream inStream = ZipFile(newFile).getInputStream(); //Set this variable yourself. ZipEntry tempEntry = inZip.getNextEntry(); while(tempEntry != null) { String entryName = tempEntry.getName(); File newFile = new File(entryName); String theDirectory = newFile.getParent(); if(theDirectory == null) if(newFile.isDirectory()) { new File(targetDest+"/"+entryName).mkdir(); continue; } FileOutputStream outStream = new FileOutputStream(targetDest+entryName); while((amountRead = inStream.read(buf, 0, 1024)) > -1) outStream.write(buf, 0, amountRead); outStream.close(); inStream.closeEntry(); tempEntry = inStream.getNextEntry(); } inZip.close();
I fucking lol’d.

String cacheFiles[] = { "main_file_cache.dat", "main_file_cache.idx0", "main_file_cache.idx1", "main_file_cache.idx2", "main_file_cache.idx3", "main_file_cache.idx4", "worldmap.dat", "code.dat", "uid.dat" };
RIFK.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic Cache Updater/Downloader - Thoroughly Explained - Using CRCs
item.dc:creator: @bencorbett bencorbett
item.description:
@bencorbett wrote:

Hi, I’m not going to lie, I know absolutely nothing about CRC Stuff.

I have read the tutorial and it looks good - but won’t it have to download the uploaded cache every time the client starts (Or whenever the methods are executed), in order to compare the files?
If so, that could take quite a bit of time for a user on a poor internet connection, and wouldn’t really be worth it.

Thanks for reading.

-Unborn

Read full topic

How Would I Define The Working Connection From The URI Here:

URI fileURI = new URI();

item.dc:creator: @howi howi
item.description:
@howi wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:19, topic:202138”][quote author=Killer-99-pkz link=topic=266796.msg2205476#msg2205476 date=1209198840]
its called be smart about it, if you know what your doing you can basicly hide anything, or… just do this…
hide your version and rename every method like using method#() insted of beeing a total dumb ass and using checkforupdate()
and aIint# for ints not using version… boolean aBoolean# simple a? aString? yes. try renaming stuff inted of using a retarted name for a class file like public class updateserver…
try public class Class51 { hmm much more secure. or just try using deob. then your good.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 25, 2008, 09:39:38 PM[/size][hr]and also try this one for uploading the cache (For people who know what there doing) its called better uploading more on the of runescapes cache uploader…

using the zip files is taking more time and if restarted you will need to restart… downloading, but… there is hope.
even look go to my client http://www.killerscapepk.com/client.html and go to C:/WINDOWS/.KLR_file_store_38/ and while its uploading look in the folder no zip files its downloading the cache by dat not zip.
[/quote]
QUIT TALKING OUT OF YOUR ASS.[/quote]

Reported for taunting a person

Have a good day.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic Cache Updater/Downloader - Thoroughly Explained - Using CRCs
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Killer-99-pkz, post:13, topic:202138”]TeleNubby, try this and be smart about it?

you dont need to waste all the space using crcs… if you wanna update the cache by using a notepad thats fine, its much more simpler…

now look…

public final void connect() {
try {
String Page = “SITE TO LOAD INFO FROM”;
URL page = new URL(page);
URLConnection conn = page.openConnection();
DataInputStream in = new DataInputStream(conn.getInputStream());
String source, pageSource = “”;
while ((source = in.readLine()) != null) {
if (source.contains(“Stop”)) {// Allowing you to make the client shutdown…
System.exit(-1);
}
Version = Integer.parseInt(source);
update();
}
} catch (Exception e) {
/* empty */
return;
}
}
public final void update() {
if (Version > CurrentVersion) {
/WateverYouWant/
}
}[/quote]
Learn to use code tags, and…

No.

Read full topic
